Description.Name: False Calm
Description.Details: Weeks pass aboard the Argo in tense quiet. Contracts roll in, systems get overhauled, the crew drifts back into the routines of downtime—yet no one quite relaxes. The [[DM.Factions[faction_MinnesotaTribe],Minnesota Tribe]] has gone dark since the last campaign. No broadcasts. No incursions. No retaliation. That changes with the arrival of a sealed transmission—stamped Classified: Watch Cipher Omega-Black. One of the most secure protocols Arelle has provided, requiring a multi-part decryption key with biometric components. The attached [[DM.Factions[faction_GhostBearWatch],Ghost Bear Watch]] briefing is meticulous and alarming. The Minnesota Tribe has launched a major coordinated operation, designated Operation Cobra Strike. Without warning, they seized control of several colony worlds far closer to the Inner Sphere than their previous holdings—some within jump distance of major trade corridors. Each strike unfolded with surgical precision: small units, heavy tonnage, zero warning. From these footholds, they initiated a synchronized wave of deep raids across multiple sectors. Munitions depots. Forward command posts. Sensor networks. Even limited strikes within the borders of the Great Houses. The timing of each hit was near-perfect, and the identity of the attackers remained ambiguous long enough to paralyze defenses. According to the Watch, these raids completely bypassed the outer systems the crew had helped retake. Horgens, Star Cluster 752, Rim Worlds Republic Outpost #11—all untouched. The Watch seems to have no explanation for how they slipped past Ghost Bear lines without triggering alarms. False transponder codes. Repainted hulls. Silent jumps. It’s clear the Tribe’s veil of secrecy has not only held—it’s gotten stronger. As Darius scans the report, his jaw tightens. “This wasn’t a reaction. It was well prepared. And we’re behind again.” He glances toward the comms array. “We better head back to Melidron. I bet we’re going to hear from Arelle soon.”

Description.Name: Travel to Melidron
Description.Details: As soon as the Argo arrives in orbit above Melidron, the conference call light starts flashing. Arelle is waiting.

Description.Name: Take Your Time
Description.Details: You know Arelle will not appreciate it, but there's still business to conclude before slowly making your way to Melidron. [A new flashpoint has been created in the Melidron system to continue the campaign]

Description.Name: Head to the Conference Room
Description.Details: <color=#BFBFBF>As soon as you enter the conference room, the call light started flashing. Arelle is waiting.</color>
